p: The hydroalcoholic extract of M. peregrina leaves showed inhibitory potential against three in vitro model enzyme assays: α-glucosidase, α-amylase, and dipeptidyl peptidase IV (DPP IV). The results for pancreatic α-amylase suggested that the enzyme responded to the extract when the concentration was increased, moderated intestinal α-glucosidase inhibitory potential, and caused a gradual inhibition of the activity of mammalian DPP IV enzyme [ 20].
